intro: Bactris devia, commonly known as the red-barked palm, is a species of palm native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect trunk that is often covered with a reddish or brownish bark. The plant produces large, feather-like leaves that can reach several meters in length, providing a striking visual feature. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, and it produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to those of other palm species. Bactris devia is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forest areas.
